display_title.display_title:
Honduras - Proyecto Nuestras
            Raíces: Evaluación ambiental

docna.cdata!:
Honduras - Nuestras Raices Project :
            environmental assessment

repnme.cdata!:
Honduras - Nuestras Raices Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Honduras Nuestras Raices Project, which increases the
            participation of indigenous populations and ethnic blacks in
            the development process, and strengthens technical and
            financial management of community micro-projects and ethnic
            organizations. This report outlines pertinent environmental
            regulations and laws, assesses expected impacts and proposes
            mitigations while identifying the communities' role,
            and incorporates these risks into project planning, and
            monitoring and evaluation. Planning will address at minimum,
            defining the operation and maintenance of water supply
            systems, and the treatment and disposal of solid waste;
            reforestation; the role of the community; and coordination
            with municipal plans. Potential environmental risks also
            include impacts/hazards due to demolition, fire, and
            flooding; construction and use of temporary latrines for
            workers; water contamination and sedimentation; occupational
            health and safety concerns, such as the availability of
            protective gear and signage for danger zones; and the
            emission of particulates, dust, and gases.
